messages.content: ComfyUI-Allor is a high-performance plugin for ComfyUI that is designed for image processing. It consists of more than 90 nodes, each with numerous parameters to meet various needs.
Does ComfyUI-Allor support transparency and multi-image processing?
Yes, ComfyUI-Allor supports transparency and multi-image processing across all its modules and nodes.
Yes, ComfyUI-Allor is fully configurable and provides the option to disable any functionality that is not required.
Where can I find documentation for ComfyUI-Allor?

The documentation for ComfyUI-Allor can be found at https://nourepide.github.io/ComfyUI-Allor-Doc/. It includes information about installation, updating, all nodes including their parameters, and much more.
What happened to the images in the Allor repository?
The images were removed from the history of the Allor repository, resulting in a significant reduction in its size by a factor of about 344.
How can I contribute to ComfyUI-Allor?
You can contribute to ComfyUI-Allor by suggesting ideas, reporting bugs, or making pull requests on GitHub.
Can I run ComfyUI-Allor on cloud services?
Yes, you can run ComfyUI-Allor on another cloud service using the provided Jupiter Notebook. If you have a subscription to Colab Pro, you can also run it in Google Colab.
